Description: Fragment of shoulder of closed pottery vessel showing the head of a lion facing left with filling motifs in dark brown on cream-coloured ground. Frieze of tongues or the like above. Interior reserved.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 219, no. 59)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 110, pl. XXXIV, no. 321.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.035)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5746 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
